fields.name: Ficus lyrata
fields.description:
Ficus lyrata, also known as the lyre-leaf or oak-leaf ficus, has gained popularity as one of the leading plants of the Urban Jungle trend. Although it has been popular in home cultivation for many years, it is currently experiencing a strong renaissance. In nature, it grows in humid tropical forests and, unlike many ficuses, it does not develop aerial or supporting roots. It impresses primarily with its large leaves with an interesting shape, resembling a lyre. The leaves grow up to 25 cm long, are stiff and slightly leathery to the touch, and their edges are slightly wavy. Although in nature it grows to several meters, in home cultivation you can regulate its growth by trimming the tops of the shoots. Lyreleaf Ficus usually has an upright habit and one main stem.
Wait until 3/4 of the soil in the pot dries out before watering again.

fields.name: Calathea orbifolia
fields.description:
Calathea orbifolia is a popular houseplant with large, striped foliage. Whilst beautiful, this plant has some specific care requirements and so is best suited to slightly more experienced houseplant owners.
Calathea orbifolia grows in the undergrowth of forests in nature, so thrives in bright shady areas that mimic these conditions. While this plant requires a lot of indirect light, it does not tolerate direct sunlight. It also needs high humidity in order to thrive, so it is a good idea to place your Calathea in a bathroom, for example, behind a sheer curtain.

fields.name: Monstera deliciosa
fields.description: Monstera is an undemanding and easy to grow plant. In its natural habitat, it can most often be observed in shaded places. However, it should be remembered that in a tropical jungle, despite the shaded place, much more sun reaches it than in our conditions, so it is best to find a place at home with bright, diffused light (e.g. an eastern or western window). Monstera does not tolerate direct, scorching midday sun - it can burn its leaves. In winter, it is worth illuminating the monstera with appropriate light bulbs that will help maintain the vitality of this beautiful plant. This species does not tolerate excess water, so water the plant only when the substrate is completely dry. Light, permeable and fertile soil is best for cultivation. Monstera is a tropical plant and loves high air humidity (50% and above), which can be achieved with a humidifier. It is recommended to wipe the leaves regularly with a damp cloth to remove accumulated dust, this will make it easier for the plant to carry out the photosynthesis process.

fields.name: Opuntia
fields.description:
A cactus that owes its extremely original appearance to its flattened shoots.
The stem consists of numerous oval members that are less than 0.5 cm wide. The prickly pear branches out strongly and acquires a tree-like shape, especially visible in older specimens. The skin is dark green, with a delicate shine. It is covered with few, but long and sharp thorns, so you should be especially careful when caring for this cactus.
The plant requires a permeable substrate, preferably specialized cactus soil or a mixture of flower soil and gravel. Be careful not to let the plant rot. Watering should only be done when the soil in the pot has dried out. This species is a bit more difficult to grow. The very flat stems mean that it cannot store much water and it also dries out quite easily. Prickly pear likes a lot of sun. In winter, it goes through a period of rest, when it should be moved to a cool, bright room and stopped watering and fertilizing.

fields.name: Beaucarnea recurvata
fields.description:
Beaucarnea recurvata - "Elephant leg"
A beautiful plant from Mexico that has the shape of a small, charming tree.
Nolina is an extremely resistant plant to long-term water shortage. It has a caudex, i.e. a very characteristic distended thickening in the lower part of the trunk, where it stores water and nutrients.
Beautiful green plumes of leaves grow from the trunk of the plant, resembling grass.
Nolina looks impressive and gives the interior a tropical atmosphere.
Wait until 3/4 of the soil in the pot dries out before watering again.
